title: cmd/{dist,go}:  get path to pkg-config from PKG_CONFIG env. var.
body:
* What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?

```
go version go1.6.2 linux/amd64
```

  * What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?

```
GOARCH="386"
GOBIN=""
GOEXE=".exe"
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="windows"
GOPATH=""
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/home/mxe/mxe-go2/usr/i686-w64-mingw32.static/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/home/mxe/mxe-go2/usr/i686-w64-mingw32.static/go/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT="1"
CC="/home/mxe/mxe-go2/usr/bin/i686-w64-mingw32.static-gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-m32 -mthreads -fmessage-length=0"
CXX="/home/mxe/mxe-go2/usr/bin/i686-w64-mingw32.static-g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
```

  * What did you do?

I used Go together with [MXE](http://mxe.cc/) cross-compiling project to cross-compile Go packages using cgo from Linux to Windows. MXE provides its own pkg-config as a prefixed binary (e.g. pkg-config for `i686-w64-mingw32.static` is called `i686-w64-mingw32.static-pkg-config`).

  * What did you expect to see?

I expected Go to provide an option or env. var. to specify pkg-config location. Autoconf provides env. var. `PKG_CONFIG` for this.

  * What did you see instead?

`pkg-config` is [hardcoded](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/519b469795287dc81ab3b994f8809f61a0c802da/src/cmd/go/build.go#L1595) in Go's source.

  * What did you do?

This issue was fixed in [patch](https://codereview.appspot.com/104960043/) for Go <= 1.4 by Dimitri Ledkov in 2014. The patch was not merged. Now that code is written in Go, not in C. I have [ported](https://github.com/LuaAndC/mxe/blob/8ae76da7c90da8ba522be3b69fee4c20943f4c89/plugins/go/go-1-fixes.patch) this patch to Go 1.6. My patched version of Go works locally.
